title: Sri Lanka ranked 91st in latest Henley and Partners International Passport Index
byline: Sri Lanka has been ranked 91st in the latest rankings of the world passports by Henley and Partners International Index for Passports 2025, thus gaining visa free access to 42 countries worldwide.

title: Health Ministry’s halt on sterilization may lead to killing of stray dogs in future: Dr. Nanayakkara
byline: The decision by the Health Ministry to suspend the sterilization programmes will lead to an increase in the number of stray dogs and may result in the killing of these dogs in the future, Association of Veterinarians for Humane Management of Animal Population said.

title: Traffic lights, countdown systems to be implemented in all cities to reduce fumes, accidents
byline: The pilot project of installation and renewal of traffic countdown systems for road signs will be initiated around the country as an important and timely step taken to reduce road accidents and to protect the lives of pedestrians, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Sri Lanka’s luxury SUV market warms up as new Range Rover debuts
byline: The new Range Rover, unveiled in Sri Lanka just weeks ago, has already seen 135 units pre-booked. The first shipment of this luxury SUV, offering greater refinement and personalization than ever before, is set to arrive in the island nation in June.

title: US-Sri Lanka ties poised for growth in biotechnology and energy: policy expert
byline: Sri Lanka has significant opportunities to collaborate with the United States in the fields of biotechnology and energy, according to a US policy expert.

title: Tourism leaders push for urgent promos to meet Sri Lanka’s 2025 targets
byline: With Sri Lanka experiencing a rise in tourist arrivals compared to last year, industry leaders are calling for the urgent rollout of global promotional campaigns to sustain the momentum in order to achieve the government’s sector targets for the year.

title: CEB December quarter profit plunged amid tariff cuts
byline: Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), the state-owned utility provider, managed to report a profit for the three months ending in December 2024 despite revenues decreasing sharply after it cut tariffs twice. But the sharp fall in the finance cost helped the bottom-line despite rising costs.

title: 3% fine to be imposed if vehicles imported not registered within 90 days
byline: The vehicles imported to Sri Lanka after the ban was lifted must be registered within 90 days and failing which 3% fine will be imposed on unregistered vehicles, subject to a maximum of 45%, the Ministry of Finance said.

title: Fair weather to prevail over the island
byline: The Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre reports that mainly fair weather will prevail across the island.

title: Cops arrested for demanding bribe from tourist
byline: A sergeant and two constables were arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe from an Austrian tourist.

title: Flights halted at some Florida airports over SpaceX debris
byline: US aviation authorities temporarily halted flights at several Florida airports over concerns about debris from SpaceX’s Starship, which spun out of control shortly after launch.
